Description: Typical range for polymer cleaning to avoid thermal damage; starting at 100W for light contamination on PET, max below ~300W to prevent melting (PET melting point ~260°C). Source: Studies on Nd:YAG laser cleaning of plastics (e.g., J. Laser Appl. 2018).
Larger spot for gentle surface treatment
Lower frequency to prevent thermal damage
Short pulses for minimal thermal impact
Fast scanning to reduce heat accumulation
Multiple gentle passes for gradual cleaning
